alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 08 at 4:00AM PST until March 12 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches is possible for eastern shores of Lake Tahoe. Western Lake Tahoe communities could see 6-12 inches of new snow, while Sierra passes could see 6 to 12 inches through early this afternoon. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph along the Sierra crest. For the Winter Storm Watch above 6500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches, except 2 to 4 feet above 7000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 120 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday afternoon through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Higher snow levels Thursday night through Sunday brings the risk of flooding in lower elevations. See the Flood Watch for more details.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
